result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dionta'e L Hayes

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Dionta'e L Hayes.  Attorney Megan Marie Newport in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing. Parties advise of status. Defense request bail hearing. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Bail modified to $10,000 cash. All other conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Dionta'e L Hayes in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Dionta'e L Hayes in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 13, 14, and 16.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 15, 17, and 18 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Dionta'e L Hayes not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Dionta'e L Hayes not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Megan Newport appeared by video means. Defense motion to modify bail argued. State objects to any modification of bail. Court denies motion. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Branch 4 down. Parties contacted to reschedule hearing. Parties notified of new court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court via zoom, defendant Dionta'e L Hayes not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Newport appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defense appears in court to request case moved with co-defendant's. State does not object. Court grants. Case adjourned to 4-15-2022 9:00 am. Parties notified.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Dionta'e L Hayes not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status/scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Dionta'e L Hayes in court by video with Attorney Michael J Steinle who appears in person.  Defendant Dionta'e L Hayes in custody.  Megan Newport appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  This hearing will be streamed live on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1U3FddFaQmDrwcXp6sBGNg  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 006618,
Payable Number: 980893,
Receipt Number: 22RP003310,
Amount: $20.00
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AW, CEH (DOB: 7/9/1987), and KAVC (DOB: 2/8/1979). Defendant to keep separate from co-defendants while in custody.

Defendant Dionta'e L Hayes in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Dionta'e L Hayes in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dionta'e L Hayes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY, on behalf of the defendant, as to misdemeanor count 17.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
